name: root

conflicts.name: ^intel-tbb@2021.1:
conflicts.description: root: Please use an older intel-tbb version for ROOT

conflicts.name: ^intel-oneapi-tbb@2021.1:
conflicts.description: root: Please use an older intel-tbb/intel-oneapi-tbb version for ROOT

conflicts.name: +ipo
conflicts.description: root: LTO is not a supported configuration for building ROOT

conflicts.name: cxxstd=11
conflicts.description: root: root7 requires at least C++14

conflicts.name: cxxstd=11
conflicts.description: root: This version of root requires at least C++14

conflicts.name: cxxstd=14
conflicts.description: root: This version of root requires at least C++17

conflicts.name: cxxstd=20
conflicts.description: root: C++20 support requires root version at least 6.28.04

conflicts.name: %clang@16:
conflicts.description: root: clang 16+ support was added in root 6.26.08

conflicts.name: +python
conflicts.description: root: Spack wants python >=3.7, too new for ROOT <6.14

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: fits
variants.description: Enable support for images and data from FITS files

variants.name: fortran
variants.description: Enable the Fortran components of ROOT

variants.name: gminimal
variants.description: Ignore most of Root's feature defaults except for basic graphic options

variants.name: gsl
variants.description: Enable linking against shared libraries for GSL

variants.name: jemalloc
variants.description: Enable using the jemalloc allocator (deprecated in 6.28)

variants.name: math
variants.description: Build the new libMathMore extended math library

variants.name: memstat
variants.description: Enable a memory stats utility to detect memory leaks

variants.name: mlp
variants.description: Enable support for TMultilayerPerceptron classes' federation

variants.name: roofit
variants.description: Build the libRooFit advanced fitting package

variants.name: tmva
variants.description: Build TMVA multi variate analysis library

variants.name: tmva-cpu
variants.description: Build TMVA with CPU support for deep learning (requires BLAS)

variants.name: tmva-gpu
variants.description: Build TMVA with GPU support for deep learning (requries CUDA)

variants.name: tmva-pymva
variants.description: Enable support for Python in TMVA (requires numpy)

variants.name: tmva-sofie
variants.description: Build TMVA with support for sofie - fast inference code generation (requires protobuf 3)

variants.name: unuran
variants.description: Use UNURAN for random number generation

variants.name: vc
variants.description: Enable Vc for adding new types for SIMD programming

variants.name: vdt
variants.description: Enable set of fast and vectorisable math functions

variants.name: veccore
variants.description: Enable support for VecCore SIMD abstraction library

variants.name: vmc
variants.description: Enable the Virtual Monte Carlo interface

variants.name: webgui
variants.description: Enable web-based UI components of ROOT

variants.name: xrootd
variants.description: Build xrootd file server and its client

variants.name: cxxstd
variants.description: Use the specified C++ standard when building.

description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependencies.name: arrow
dependencies.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Arm Performance Libraries provides optimized standard core math
libraries for high-performance computing applications on Arm processors.

dependencies.name: cfitsio
dependencies.description:
CFITSIO is a library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and
writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data
format.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: cudnn
dependencies.description:
NVIDIA cuDNN is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural
networks

dependencies.name: davix
dependencies.description: High-performance file management over WebDAV/HTTP.

dependencies.name: dcap
dependencies.description: dCache access protocol client library.

dependencies.name: fcgi
dependencies.description:
FastCGI is simple because it is actually CGI with only a few extensions.
Like CGI, FastCGI is also language-independent. For instance, FastCGI
provides a way to improve the performance of the thousands of Perl
applications that have been written for the Web.

dependencies.name: fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: ftgl
dependencies.description: Library to use arbitrary fonts in OpenGL applications.

dependencies.name: gl
dependencies.description: Shim package for the OSMesa OpenGL library.

dependencies.name: gl2ps
dependencies.description:
GL2PS is a C library providing high quality vector output for any OpenGL
application.

dependencies.name: glew
dependencies.description: The OpenGL Extension Wrangler Library.

dependencies.name: glu
dependencies.description: This package provides the Mesa OpenGL Utility library.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: graphviz
dependencies.description: Graph Visualization Software

dependencies.name: gsl
dependencies.description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: jemalloc
dependencies.description:
jemalloc is a general purpose malloc(3) implementation that emphasizes
fragmentation avoidance and scalable concurrency support.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg is a widely used free library with functions for handling the
JPEG image data format. It implements a JPEG codec (encoding and
decoding) alongside various utilities for handling JPEG data.

dependencies.name: libice
dependencies.description: libICE - Inter-Client Exchange Library.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: libsm
dependencies.description: libSM - X Session Management Library.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxft
dependencies.description:
X FreeType library. Xft version 2.1 was the first stand alone release of
Xft, a library that connects X applications with the FreeType font
rasterization library. Xft uses fontconfig to locate fonts so it has no
configuration files.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: libxpm
dependencies.description: libXpm - X Pixmap (XPM) image file format library.

dependencies.name: lz4
dependencies.description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: mysql-client
dependencies.description: MySQL is an open source relational database management system.

dependencies.name: ncurses
dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: nlohmann-json
dependencies.description: JSON for Modern C++

dependencies.name: openssl
dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.

dependencies.name: oracle-instant-client
dependencies.description: Oracle instant client

dependencies.name: pcre
dependencies.description:
The PCRE package contains Perl Compatible Regular Expression libraries.
These are useful for implementing regular expression pattern matching
using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: postgresql
dependencies.description:
PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system.
It has more than 15 years of active development and a proven
architecture that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability,
data integrity, and correctness.

dependencies.name: protobuf
dependencies.description: Google's data interchange format.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: pythia6
dependencies.description:
PYTHIA is a program for the generation of high-energy physics events,
i.e. for the description of collisions at high energies between
elementary particles such as e+, e-, p and pbar in various combinations.
PYTHIA6 is a Fortran package which is no longer maintained: new
prospective users should use Pythia8 instead. This recipe includes
patches required to interoperate with Root.

dependencies.name: pythia8
dependencies.description:
The Pythia program is a standard tool for the generation of events in
high-energy collisions, comprising a coherent set of physics models for
the evolution from a few-body hard process to a complex multiparticle
final state.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: qt
dependencies.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: r
dependencies.description:
R is 'GNU S', a freely available language and environment for
statistical computing and graphics which provides a wide variety of
statistical and graphical techniques: linear and nonlinear modelling,
statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering,
etc. Please consult the R project homepage for further information.

dependencies.name: r-rcpp
dependencies.description:
Seamless R and C++ Integration. The 'Rcpp' package provides R functions
as well as C++ classes which; offer a seamless integration of R and C++.
Many R data types and objects can be; mapped back and forth to C++
equivalents which facilitates both writing of new; code as well as
easier integration of third-party libraries. Documentation; about 'Rcpp'
is provided by several vignettes included in this package, via the;
'Rcpp Gallery' site at <https://gallery.rcpp.org>, the paper by
Eddelbuettel and; Francois (2011, <doi:10.18637/jss.v040.i08>), the book
by Eddelbuettel (2013,; <doi:10.1007/978-1-4614-6868-4>) and the paper
by Eddelbuettel and Balamuta (2018,;
<doi:10.1080/00031305.2017.1375990>); see 'citation("Rcpp")' for
details.

dependencies.name: r-rinside
dependencies.description:
C++ Classes to Embed R in C++ (and C) Applications. C++ classes to embed
R in C++ applications The 'RInside' packages makes it easier to have "R
inside" your C++ application by providing a C++ wrapperclass providing
the R interpreter. As R itself is embedded into your application, a
shared library build of R is required. This works on Linux, OS X and
even on Windows provided you use the same tools used to build R itself.
Numerous examples are provided in the eight subdirectories of the
examples/ directory of the installed package: standard, mpi (for
parallel computing) qt (showing how to embed 'RInside' inside a Qt GUI
application), wt (showing how to build a "web-application" using the Wt
toolkit), armadillo (for 'RInside' use with 'RcppArmadillo') and eigen
(for 'RInside' use with 'RcppEigen'). The example use GNUmakefile(s)
with GNU extensions, so a GNU make is required (and will use the
GNUmakefile automatically). Doxygen-generated documentation of the C++
classes is available at the 'RInside' website as well.

dependencies.name: readline
dependencies.description:
The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by
applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed
in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library
includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered
command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform
csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

dependencies.name: shadow
dependencies.description:
Tools to help unprivileged users create uid and gid mappings in user
namespaces.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

dependencies.name: tbb
dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.

dependencies.name: unuran
dependencies.description: Universal Non-Uniform Random number generator.

dependencies.name: vc
dependencies.description: SIMD Vector Classes for C++

dependencies.name: vdt
dependencies.description:
Vectorised math. A collection of fast and inline implementations of
mathematical functions.

dependencies.name: veccore
dependencies.description:
SIMD Vectorization Library for VecGeom and GeantV. VecCore is a header-
only (interface) library so no cmake arguments are necessary.

dependencies.name: xextproto
dependencies.description: X Protocol Extensions.

dependencies.name: xproto
dependencies.description:
X Window System Core Protocol. This package provides the headers and
specification documents defining the X Window System Core Protocol,
Version 11. It also includes a number of headers that aren't purely
protocol related, but are depended upon by many other X Window System
packages to provide common definitions and porting layer.

dependencies.name: xrootd
dependencies.description:
The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault
tolerant access to data repositories of many kinds.

dependencies.name: xxhash
dependencies.description:
xxHash is an Extremely fast Hash algorithm, running at RAM speed limits.
It successfully completes the SMHasher test suite which evaluates
collision, dispersion and randomness qualities of hash functions. Code
is highly portable, and hashes are identical on all platforms (little /
big endian).

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependent_to.name: edm4hep
dependent_to.description: Event data model of Key4hep.

dependent_to.name: cnvnator
dependent_to.description:
A tool for CNV discovery and genotyping from depth-of-coverage by mapped
reads.

dependent_to.name: unigen
dependent_to.description:
The United Generators project was launched by the Virtual Institute 146
VI-SIM in September 2005 following a proposal of Herbert Strobele. The
goal was to facilitate comparison between various models (see below)
and/or various experiments (HADES, FOPI, CERES, NA49, CBM). The package
at present allows to convert output of various event generators to a
generic root format.

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: genie
dependent_to.description: Genie is a neutrino Monte Carlo Generator.

dependent_to.name: kassiopeia
dependent_to.description: Simulation of electric and magnetic fields and particle tracking.

dependent_to.name: dd4hep
dependent_to.description:
DD4hep is a software framework for providing a complete solution for
full detector description (geometry, materials, visualization, readout,
alignment, calibration, etc.) for the full experiment life cycle
(detector concept development, detector optimization, construction,
operation). It offers a consistent description through a single source
of detector information for simulation, reconstruction, analysis, etc.
It distributed under the LGPLv3 License.

dependent_to.name: acts
dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.

dependent_to.name: professor
dependent_to.description: Professor Monte-Carlo tuning package

dependent_to.name: sherpa
dependent_to.description:
Sherpa is a Monte Carlo event generator for the Simulation of High-
Energy Reactions of PArticles in lepton-lepton, lepton-photon, photon-
photon, lepton-hadron and hadron-hadron collisions.

dependent_to.name: geant3
dependent_to.description:
Simulation software using Monte Carlo methods to describe how particles
pass through matter.

dependent_to.name: pythia8
dependent_to.description:
The Pythia program is a standard tool for the generation of events in
high-energy collisions, comprising a coherent set of physics models for
the evolution from a few-body hard process to a complex multiparticle
final state.

dependent_to.name: opendatadetector
dependent_to.description: Open Data Detector for High Energy Physics.

dependent_to.name: vgm
dependent_to.description:
Virtual Geometry Model (VGM) is a geometry conversion tool, actually
providing conversion between Geant4 and ROOT TGeo geometry models.

dependent_to.name: bdsim
dependent_to.description:
Beam Delivery Simulation (BDSIM) is a C++ program that utilises the
Geant4 toolkit to simulate both the transport of particles in an
accelerator and their interaction with the accelerator material

dependent_to.name: celeritas
dependent_to.description:
Celeritas is a new Monte Carlo transport code designed for high-
performance (GPU-targeted) simulation of high-energy physics detectors.

dependent_to.name: py-hepdata-lib
dependent_to.description: Library for getting your data into HEPData

dependent_to.name: sartre
dependent_to.description:
Sartre 1 is an event generator for exclusive diffractive vector meson
production and DVCS in ep and eA collisions based on the dipole model.

dependent_to.name: gate
dependent_to.description:
Simulations of Preclinical and Clinical Scans in Emission Tomography,
Transmission Tomography and Radiation Therapy GATE is an advanced
opensource software developed by the international OpenGATE
collaboration and dedicated to numerical simulations in medical imaging
and radiotherapy. It currently supports simulations of Emission
Tomography (Positron Emission Tomography - PET and Single Photon
Emission Computed Tomography - SPECT), Computed Tomography (CT), Optical
Imaging (Bioluminescence and Fluorescence) and Radiotherapy experiments.
Using an easy-to-learn macro mechanism to configurate simple or highly
sophisticated experimental settings, GATE now plays a key role in the
design of new medical imaging devices, in the optimization of
acquisition protocols and in the development and assessment of image
reconstruction algorithms and correction techniques. It can also be used
for dose calculation in radiotherapy experiments.

dependent_to.name: gatepet2stir
dependent_to.description: A QT/C++ application to convert GATE geometries to STIR format.

dependent_to.name: relax
dependent_to.description:
A set of Reflex libraries for the most common used general data types in
the LHC Computing Grid

dependent_to.name: cool
dependent_to.description:
COOL provides specific software components and tools for the handling of
the time variation and versioning of the experiment conditions data.

dependent_to.name: genfit
dependent_to.description:
GenFit is an experiment-independent framework for track reconstruction
in particle and nuclear physics

dependent_to.name: delphes
dependent_to.description:
A high energy physics framework for fast simulation of a generic
collider experiment.

dependent_to.name: lcio
dependent_to.description: HEP Library for Linear Collider Input/Output

dependent_to.name: cepgen
dependent_to.description: A generic central exclusive processes event generator

dependent_to.name: crmc
dependent_to.description:
CRMC (Cosmic Ray Monte Carlo package). CRMC is a package providing a
common interface to access the output from event generators used to
model the secondary particle production in hadronic collisons.

dependent_to.name: cutlang
dependent_to.description:
CutLang is a domain specific language that aims to provide a clear,
human readable way to define analyses in high energy particle physics
(HEP) along with an interpretation framework of that language.

dependent_to.name: podio
dependent_to.description:
PODIO, or plain-old-data I/O, is a C++ library to support the creation
and handling of data models in particle physics.

dependent_to.name: hepmc3
dependent_to.description:
The HepMC package is an object oriented, C++ event record for High
Energy Physics Monte Carlo generators and simulation.

dependent_to.name: vmc
dependent_to.description: The Virtual Monte Carlo (VMC) library

dependent_to.name: hepmcanalysis
dependent_to.description:
The HepMCAnalysis Tool is a tool for generator validation and
comparisons.

dependent_to.name: yoda
dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

dependent_to.name: gbl
dependent_to.description: General Broken Lines: Advanced track fitting library

dependent_to.name: vecgeom
dependent_to.description:
The vectorized geometry library for particle-detector simulation
(toolkits).

dependent_to.name: garfieldpp
dependent_to.description:
Garfield++ is a toolkit for the detailed simulation of particle
detectors based on ionisation measurement in gases and semiconductors.
